content: all hexed away by becky simmons copyright 2024 how to join same sized hexagons with the continuous join-as-you-go method yarn any sample used loops & threads impeccable / bernat premium / red heart with love hook appropriate for the yarn sample used 6mm total yardage for sample 600 yards hexagons 425 yards join 175 yards glossary of terms chain = chain stitch finished size sample measures 32 from top to double_crochet = double_crochet bottom each hex measures 9 from flat side to slip_stitch = slip_stitch flat side granny hex pattern start working in the round the way you normally would i prefer simply doing ch1 then my turning chain and working into that first chain r1 ch2 turning chain double_crochet ch1 2dc ch1 five times slip_stitch to join to top of turning chain r2 ch2 double_crochet into ch1 space below the turning chain 2dc ch1 2dc into next ch1 space five times 2dc into next space where your turning chain is ch1 join with a slip_stitch r3 ch2 double_crochet into ch1 space below the turning chain 2dc in next space 2dc ch1 2dc in next space 5 times double_crochet into next space where your turning chain is ch1 join with a slip_stitch continue adding rounds doing 2dc ch1 2dc in the corner holes ch1 spaces and 2dc into the sides spaces not made by chs make 7 hexagons each with 8 rounds continuous join-as-you-go picture tutorial below continuous join-as-you-go video tutorial https //youtu be/w6rdxxzdr5w rh schematic start in the top right corner and follow the line to join lh schematic start in the top left corner and follow the line to join continuous join-as-you-go for hexagons this is a simple layout but you can adapt this join method for any hexagon layout for the purposes of this joining method lay out the hexagons so that a flat side is pointed up rather than a corner start on the hexagon that is at the top of the right- most column of hexagons start in the top right corner of the hexagon and follow the pattern for your hexagon around 4 sides join with a slip_stitch at every hole with granny hexagons join at regular intervals with any other pattern round take your second hexagon in that column and join it to the first if this is not your last hexagon crochet 3 more sides if this is your last hexagon and the next column ends lower crochet 2 more sides if this is your last hexagon and the next column ends higher crochet 1 more side when adding the second column crochet and join up the sides of the hexagons that meet up with the sides of the first column when you get to a place where two previous hexagons are joined slip_stitch join through the space between the two hexagons meeting corner the hook is pointing at this hole in the picture crochet the rest of the way around each hexagon in this
